Author: ElderSmackJack

Comment: Just because I express my opinion on a subreddit does not mean that my opinion is only relevant to that sub. My opinions come from the real world which includes witnessing years of NYT putting their thumb on the scales.  - The "NYT Pitchbot" wouldn't exist if there weren't a kernel of truth. (https://bsky.app/profile/nytpitchbot.bsky.social) - Maggie Haberman does exist and still does her access journalism schtick. - AG Sulzberger did, in fact, say he was pushing the Times towards mindless both sides content. (https://presswatchers.org/2024/03/why-is-new-york-times-campaign-coverage-so-bad-because-thats-what-the-publisher-wants/) - The Times did, in fact, have more headlines about "buttery emails" than Clinton policy (https://www.vox.com/2017/12/7/16747712/study-media-2016-election-clintons-emails) - The Times did fixate on Hunter Biden instead of, I dunno, the fascists. (https://www.nytimes.com/topic/hunter-biden) - If Mags weren't bad enough, David Sanger is also still employed at NYT (https://www.emptywheel.net/2024/07/10/the-lie-david-sanger-told-to-sustain-nyts-non-stop-campaign-against-joe-biden/) - The Times was an active participant, and possible originator, of the "Biden is too old" narrative. (https://css.seas.upenn.edu/new-york-times-a-case-study-in-inconsistent-narrative-selection-and-framing-that-tends-to-favor-republicans/)
Author: Grandpa_No
